SEARCH
Package org.example.task1

Class OddIndexEntries

java.lang.Object
org.example.task1.OddIndexEntries
public class OddIndexEntries extends Object
Utility class for collecting entries from various data structures based on their index or key.

  • Constructor Details

    • OddIndexEntries

      public OddIndexEntries()

  • Method Details

    • collectGenericEntries

      public static <T> List<T> collectGenericEntries(Collection<T> collection)
      Collects entries from a collection based on their odd indices.

      If the provided collection is an instance of List, it is directly used. Otherwise, the collection is converted to a List.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of elements in the collection.
      Parameters:
      collection - The collection from which to collect entries.
      Returns:
      A list of entries from the collection with odd indices.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the collection or any of its elements are null.

    • collectEntriesToString

      public static String collectEntriesToString(List<String> list)
      Collects entries from a list of strings based on their odd indices and joins them into a single string.

      The entries are concatenated with ", " as the delimiter.

      Parameters:
      list - The list of strings from which to collect entries.
      Returns:
      A string of entries from the list with odd indices, joined by ", ".
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the list or any of its elements are null.

    • collectEntriesFromMap

      public static Map<Integer,String> collectEntriesFromMap(Map<Integer,String> map)
      Collects entries from a map based on their odd keys.

      If the map is null, an empty map is returned. Only entries with non-null keys that are odd are collected.

      Parameters:
      map - The map from which to collect entries.
      Returns:
      A map of entries with odd keys.
